alert.note: Alert for Olympics (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 07 at 2:46PM PST until January 09 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TUESDAY TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 2000 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 12 inches. For the Blizzard Warning above 2000 feet, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 28 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Olympic mountains and valleys, including Hurricane Ridge, Amanda Park, and Quinault. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 7 AM Monday to 4 AM PST Tuesday. For the Blizzard Warning, from 4 AM Tuesday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
